questions.stem: Which of the following is a core assumption of the adaptive information processing (AIP) model upon which EMDR is based?
options: Pathology results from traumatic memories that are unprocessed or maladaptively processed by the brain’s information system
Anxiety responses are solely conditioned and extinguished through repeated exposure
Relaxation response inhibits fear through reciprocal inhibition
Addictions arise only from operant conditioning mechanisms
questions.answer: Pathology results from traumatic memories that are unprocessed or maladaptively processed by the brain’s information system
questions.explanation: The AIP model posits that trauma-related pathology occurs because traumatic experiences are not fully or adaptively processed, leading to dysfunction which EMDR aims to resolve.
questions.kn_explanation: This question targets theoretical foundations of EMDR, a classical conditioning-related intervention, fitting learning theories in KN7.
questions.quality_comment: Well-formulated question testing understanding of a model underlying an intervention, with plausible and distinct distractors.

questions.stem: In a frequency polygon depicting test scores that are negatively skewed, which of the following accurately describes the relative positions of the mean, median, and mode?

Mode > Median > Mean
Mean = Median = Mode
Median > Mean > Mode
questions.answer: Mode > Median > Mean
questions.explanation: In negatively skewed distributions, the mode (peak) has the highest value, the median is intermediate, and the mean is pulled toward the lower (negative) tail.

questions.stem: In inferential statistics, the standard error of the mean decreases when which of the following occurs?
options: The population standard deviation decreases.
The sample size increases.
The variance of the population increases.
The alpha level is set lower.
questions.answer: The sample size increases.
questions.explanation: The standard error of the mean equals the population standard deviation divided by the square root of the sample size, so increasing sample size decreases standard error.
questions.kn_explanation: This question requires understanding of how sample size and variability affect the precision of sample estimates (KN53).
questions.quality_comment: Distractors are plausible and test comprehension of how key parameters influence sampling variability, reinforcing key sampling distribution concepts.

questions.stem: Which of the following accurately describes the stopping rule (ceiling) when administering a Stanford-Binet 5th Edition subtest?

questions.stem: Regarding maintenance and storage of professional records, APA’s Record Keeping Guidelines recommend retaining client records for at least how long if no legal requirement supersedes?

questions.stem: What best describes higher-order conditioning?

A neutral stimulus is paired with an already established conditioned stimulus, causing the neutral stimulus to evoke the conditioned response

questions.answer: A neutral stimulus is paired with an already established conditioned stimulus, causing the neutral stimulus to evoke the conditioned response
